title: Analysis from graph of f' part - c

content.description:
Note: This is the graph of the derivative of f, not the graph of f.

The figure above shows the graph of f ′ , the derivative of a function f. The domain of f is the set of all real numbers x such that−3 <x <5 .
content.question: On what intervals is the graph of f concave upward? Use <math> <msup> <mi> f </mi> <mo> ′ </mo> </msup> </math> to justify your answer.

frqParts.text: On what intervals is the graph of f concave upward? Use <math> <msup> <mi> f </mi> <mo> ′ </mo> </msup> </math> to justify your answer.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
